byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard reported from Istanbul, and Maher Samaan from Beirut, Lebanon. Tim Arango and Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Istanbul.
byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and MAHER SAMAAN

abstract: Kurdish militias and Arab rebels gain partial control of Islamic State-held town of Tal Abyad, near Syria's border with Turkey; advance, aided by United States-led airstrikes, invigorates opposition fighters and threatens jihadists' control of region.
lead_paragraph: Capturing the town, Tal Abyad, on the Turkish border, would subvert a major ISIS supply line and help create a contiguous slice of Kurdish-held land.

headline.main: Kurds and Syrian Rebels Storm ISIS-Held Border Town
headline.print_headline: Kurdish Fighters in Syria Seize Much of ISIS Stronghold

snippet: Capturing the town, Tal Abyad, on the Turkish border, would subvert a major ISIS supply line and help create a contiguous slice of Kurdish-held land.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
